body: @ByteFlinger The plugin targets 16.1 today which doesn't seem to have pipeline group in it's response. But from the oldest plugin API docs [that's available](https://plugin-api.go.cd/16.3.0/notifications/#stage-status-changed) (from 16.3.0) - it seems to have group information in the request body. So if we upgrade the Go version dependency - we might be able to support this feature.

issue.title: Support for notifications based on pipeline group name

repository.name: gocd-slack-build-notifier
repository.description: GoCD (gocd.org) plugin to push build notifications to Slack

issue.body:
Fixes #65 

Major changes
1. Updating the min GoCD support to 16.3.0. Given that's the oldest [plugin API documentation](https://plugin-api.go.cd/16.3.0/notifications/#stage-status-changed) available online that seems to support pipeline group names. 
2. `RulesTest.java` has lot of changes because I changed the line encodings from windows format to Linux format. 

@jdavisp3 Please review this for me when you've time. 
cc: @ByteFlinger

body: @ByteFlinger The new release [1.4.0-RC11](https://github.com/ashwanthkumar/gocd-slack-build-notifier/releases/tag/v1.4.0-RC11) has this feature. Please do give it a shot and let us know your feedback.

Hi

I am not sure this is working as expected. I have been testing this for a while now but notifications just stopped coming.

I have a configuration like this (All values below are dummy)

```
gocd.slack {
  login = "gocd_login"
  password = "gocd_password"
  server-host = "http://gocd.host.com:8153"
  api-server-host = "http://localhost:8153/"
  webhookUrl = "https://hooks.slack.com/services/HSSSTSS/S4DN7AS/UHwf5HH7S"

  slackDisplayName = "gocd-slack-bot"
  slackUserIconURL = "https://api.go.cd/current/images/logo.png"

  displayMaterialChanges = true

  proxy {
    hostname = "192.168.2.3"
    port = "3128"
    type = "http" # acceptable values are http / socks
  }

  pipelines = [{
    name = ".*"
    stage = ".*"
    group = "Group1|Group2"
    state = "failed|fixed|broken"
    channel = "#somechannel"
    webhookUrl = "https://hooks.slack.com/services/HSSSTSS/S4DN7AS/UHwf5HH7S"
  },
  {
    name = ".*"
    stage = ".*"
    group = "Group3"
    state = "failed|fixed|broken"
    channel = "#otherchannel"
    webhookUrl = "https://hooks.slack.com/services/JSSTS/HgggH777/JJJ888kl9HHHFD4"
  }]
}
```

And yet I get no notification and this comes out in the logs

```
GoNotificationPlugin:52 - My-Pipeline/8/someStage/1 has Failed/Failed
Server:52 - Fetching http://localhost:8153/go/api/pipelines/My-Pipeline/history
PipelineListener:62 - Couldn't find any matching rule for My-Pipeline/someStage with status=Failed
```

My-Pipeline in this case is assigned to pipeline group Group1

Am I missing something? I got the feeling that it worked when I tested the first time but it has been quiet for a very long time now

@ByteFlinger You might want to remove your actual webhook urls from the above comment. 
Also can you please check and let me know what version of plugin are you using along with the GoCD version too.

Hi

The hook URLs are dummies. They are not real. I left them there to show the exact layout of our config

We are used by Gocd 17.1 (upgraded to 17.2 today) and the version of the plugin is the latest 1.4.0-RC11.

I vaguely remember testing it before actual going ahead with it in production and it seemed to work but then it just got quiet
@ashwanthkumar Anything I can help to debug here?
@ByteFlinger I tried running things locally and I'm not able to reproduce the issue. Can you please double-check if the proxy settings are right?

Hi @ashwanthkumar 

Sorry for the late reply here. I am certain the proxy settings are right, I have never changed them and I doubled checked now and everything is as expected. The logs imply that it simply does not think that there are any configurations for all the pipelines triggers that happen within go

issue.title: Pipeline rules not correctly applying

repository.name: gocd-slack-build-notifier
repository.description: GoCD (gocd.org) plugin to push build notifications to Slack

issue.body:
Using the rules from [pipeline-rules](https://github.com/ashwanthkumar/gocd-slack-build-notifier#pipeline-rules), it seems to be ignoring the "group" setting, and just matching all names (".*") and the state, then posting on that.

Trying to categorize pipelines based on groups, but it's not working as expected. Is there any log file that's generated for the plugin, or any way to get a debug log output?

Here is the conf file I am using (sensitive details removed):

`gocd.slack {`
`  login = "USERNAME"`
`  password = "PASSWORD"`
`  server-host = "SERVER_URL"`
`  api-server-host = "SERVER_URL"`
`  webhookUrl = "WEBHOOK_URL"`

`  # optional fields`
`  channel = "#gocd"`
`  slackDisplayName = "gocd-slack-bot"`
`  displayMaterialChanges = true`
`  proxy {`
`    hostname = "PROXY_DETAILS"`
`    port = "PORT"`
`    type = "http" # acceptable values are http / socks`
`  }`

`  pipelines = [{`
`    name = ".*"`
`    stage = ".*"`
`    group = ".*BI.*"`
`    state = "failed|cancelled|fixed|broken"`
`    channel = "#bi_gocd"`
`    webhookUrl = "WEBHOOK_URL"`
`  },`
`  {`
`    name = ".*"`
`    stage = ".*"`
`    group = ".*NAG.*"`
`    state = "failed|cancelled|fixed|broken"`
`    channel = "@USER"`
`    webhookUrl = "WEBHOOK_URL"`
`  },`
`  {`
`    name = ".*"`
`    stage = ".*"`
`    group = ".*"`
`    state = "all"`
`    channel = "#gocd"`
`    webhookUrl = "WEBHOOK_URL"`
`  }]`
`}`

But using the above, everything is being posted into the #bi_gocd channel, regardless of the assigned group. From the testing I've done, it seems to be ignoring the "group" setting, and just matching all names (".*") and the state, then posting on that

EDIT: Not everything being posted in #bi_gocd. "Building" and success status messages are being posted to #gocd, and all failures are going to #bi_gocd
